page.title: 09ARTS AND CRAFTS.
page.content: The Art Gallery was given to the village at the end of the last century by Passmore Edwards, the famous founder of libraries,who was born at Blackwater.It is built of granite and has four large copper reliefs of a serpent,a dragon,seagulls and fishes.They stand for earth, air,water and fire and are the work of the local craftmen.The director of the Gallery is John Halkes. The Gallery organizes touring exhibitions and outside Art events. There is also a broad appeal exhibition programme thoughout the year and a specialist poetry book- shop with regular monthly poetry readings.
